intro: Megalochlamys ogadenensis, commonly known as the Ogaden sand thorn, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and thorny stems. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Megalochlamys ogadenensis is adapted to withstand drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitat.
